title: Ida+Windbg alternative of Olly's "Back to user code" feature
content:
I'm learning lena151's materials and in 4 lesson she uses Olly's Back-to-user feature to find where the MassegeBox is creating.

It works fine under x32 windows server 2003.
But what about nowadays?!
Is there similar option in IDA+WINDBG for x64 apps?
Coz I've tried setting BP to the .text section but I faced the message of IDA 'BP set is failed coz of break point overlapping' (so you should delete all previous if some was set)

answers_data.content:
I've got found incredibly good plugin for IDA. The tools: PixtopianBook.exe (lena151's 4th tutorial). IDA 7.6 x86. Funcap python script for ida. The task: Do any action and find out which function was called. The recipe: 1. Get the script by typing 
git clone https://github.com/deresz/funcap.git
2. Run IDA and select the Local Windows debugger (Windbg froze up when launch with lots of breakpoints). 3. Run process as usual, right till the exe fully loads up. 4. Pause process, hold ALT+F7 and select 
funcap.py
script 5. Now type in command line 
d.hookSeg('.text')
and run process. 6. Now just click the interesting button and wait till it fully drawn. 7. You will see a lot of logs in the IDA output, select and copy whole text to some notepad and search for 
MessageBox
. Here we go :ли
